name: Samos Bay Hotel by Gagou Beach

reviews.text: It was a first time in unknown Samos, Greece, not Greek speaking & trying to impress my small group with a quality, clean hotel without blowing the budget on a resort style megapolis. Gagou beach hotel fit the bill.
reviews.title: Gagou beach is no joke

reviews.text: Brilliant location onto a small clean pebble beach (12 minute stroll into town), leisurely atmospheric with it's own home-made-feel restaurant. Great views from every room balcony. Friendly informative staff & free lobby wifi + computer access.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Samos is perfect for access/exit to/from Turkey & a beautiful island to tour via vespa or soft-top jeep. We loved our stay
reviews.title: Simple, but fine

reviews.text: A very very good hotel in a good location. Excellent service who give you a lovely welcome. Clean and everything perfect. Highly recommended. 21/7/2012-28/7/2012. From Cyprus. Από Κύπρο με αγάπη Ελένη.
reviews.title: Greek beauty-not in crisis

reviews.text: Hotel is nice and clean. The location is right to the Gangou beach. The service is good, nothing to complain. All rooms have seaview, they are clean, toiled and shower are OK, small but suffice.
reviews.title: Samos Bay Hotel, Gagou Beach.

reviews.text: Gagou Beach Hotel is certainly nothing fancy, but once you see the view from your balcony there's not much more you could want. This is my second stay here (the first was back in June 2005). The rooms we stayed in have tiled floors, two single beds, and a small bathroom with toilet, basin, and a shower over the bath. Fittings, beds etc are old and plain but are clean and perfectly acceptable for the low cost of the hotel. There is a relatively large balcony with the most fantastic view. Two computers downstairs allow relatively unimpeded free computer access. Breakfast is included (cold boiled eggs, meats, cheeses, fruit, cereals, juice, coffee and tea). A couple of the staff can be very difficult, a complaint I had on both trips. The young woman at the front counter told us explicitly no rooms were available when we attempted to lengthen our stay. I booked a room through the hotel's own website and had her print out the confirmation for me, which I have to say i enjoyed! However the staff all speak excellent English, and this woman's male colleagues were unfailingly helpful and polite. The hotel is a short (less than ten minute) and easy stroll into town, but the location of Gagou is so much nicer than staying in town. One word of warning - it is fantastic to hire scooters here to explore the rest of the island, but you do need a motorbike licence now to do so. We made do with a small car but these are quite a lot more expensive (up to 80 euros versus 25 euros for a scooter).
reviews.title: AMAZING LOCATION - THIS HOTEL IS ALL YOU NEED

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After I booked this hotel, I learned the ferry schedule. The Mykonos ferry would arrive around 10:30 and the next morning we had to be at the port for the Kusadasi ferry by 7:30. The hotel was quite a walk from the port and in the morning it would be totally uphill with luggage. Unfortunately, the cancellation policy was very restrictive – like weeks before arrival date, so I couldn’t change it.
reviews.title: Not good for a quick stay

reviews.text: When we arrived around 11-ish at night, we got our room and I was disappointed because it was on the first floor right next to reception and the walkup PCs. Oh well, we just needed to go to bed and get up early the next day. My husband wanted to read first and the reading light was burnt out, so we got the front desk in and they replaced it. Then I went to the bathroom and it turns out it wouldn’t flush, so we had to bring the front desk in again to fix it. Not exactly conducive to getting a good night’s sleep. Turns out we realized he didn’t really fix it totally because now every time we flushed we would have to lift up the lid and move the stopper so it would cover the pipe. Ridiculous. Did they give us the worst room in the hotel because we were only staying for 1 night?
reviews.title: good place to relax

reviews.text: After lights out, I was hearing lots of German conversation outside my room. Finally, I went out there to beg them to shut up. Turns out 6 young people were gathered around the PCs just chatting at 1:30am. Good news is that after I requested them to be quiet, they dispersed.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel but don't take half board

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Woke up the next morning and went outside and saw that the hotel was nicely situated on the beach. I thought to myself this must be why they get good reviews. The breakfast which we couldn’t stay for seemed decent, not great. The breakfast room seemed nice. We had to ask front desk to call us a cab as we wouldn’t make it to the port on time if we had to walk uphill for 30 minutes with luggage. The front desk estimated it would cost 2 or 3 euros; the cab charged us 7 euros.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: Gagou Beach Hotel aka Samos Bay Hotel. Just to clear up the confusion...
reviews.title: Location, location, location

reviews.text: I would describe this place as a budget full service hotel. It has everything, but on a modest scale. Elevator, air con, late night bar, 24 hour reception, restaurant, internet stations, handicap access. The lobby is very nice, but this is not a designer hotel. The rooms were quite ordinary, not as shown on the website. That said, the best thing about the hotel is its position right at a small beach. Every room has a seaview and a balcony. Very relaxing. As noted in other reviews, it is an easy 15 minute walk to Samos town. Overall, I made an excellent choice for being in that area. I paid 60 euros a night for a small double room - fine for me traveling alone. The staff was professional, friendly, and helpful at all times. The bed was quite good and the pillows were perfect. The cons, however: weak wifi in the room, low pressure shower, water never got really hot, no safe in the room (safe deposit boxes at reception, though). The buffet breakfast was average for Greek properties. I'd say this is a very good choice for families and couples, especially if you can get a good deal.
reviews.title: Very relaxing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Some people have complained that there is a small charge for sunbeds at the beach. Come on, people! That is standard all over Greece and the cost is lower on Samos than in Athens or Mykonos, for examples. If you want free, lay on your towel and bring your own umbrella.
reviews.title: Gagou Beach-Samos Bay Hotel Outstrips Competition

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A side note: if you are going to take round trips to Kusadasi/Ephesus, Ikaria, Patmos, etc., you would be better off staying at Pithagori, where the ferries mostly go. It is a really nice quaint little seaside town and seems to have more restaurants than Samos town. Otherwise, it is a 15 to 20 minute drive from Samos town and if you don't rent a vehicle, you will find the taxi is rather expensive. If you want a quiet and pleasant village by the sea, I also highly recommend Kokkari. I'd avoid Karlovassi, as it has no charm at all.
reviews.title: Good choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here for a week with my family, Hotel was great, rooms were a little small but still very good. I had a big balcony on the 3rd floor with a beautiful view of the beach. The beach itself was very nice and clean, and there was also great service on the beach from the hotel. The place was very quiet and away from town, but not too far of a walk.
reviews.title: Escape from it all

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is in pretty good location, about 800 m from the centre of Samos town, right on the beach. I liked the view from our, we could see the beach from balcony. Every room has a see view. On the good site: the staff in hotel is very nice and helpfull in every way. We had a great terrace, were we could sit and enjoy nice view. The hotel restaurant in very nice decorated, with lights and every night different arrangements on the dinner tables. Very romantic and nice music. On the downsite: the food. A small variety at dinner, there was just three different dishes and everything was cold all the time. The food was in my opinion always leftovers from the night before. Some spaghetti and grind meet or something like that. The hotel has no swimming pool so I thought sunbeds on the beach could be free, but they weren't. There is no cleanig service on Sundays and we had a flood on our balcony from the room in the higher level, because the maids didn't empty bootles of water from AC. There is also a big rift under the door so one evening we found a cockroach, which came under the door to our room. Overall it's not so bad, we had a wonderfull stay and great time, but the food could really be at least warm.
reviews.title: Nice beach-but average hotel

reviews.text: We stayed here for three days in July and were made very welcome. The hotel team were very good at helping us to work around the taxi strike hitting Greece at that point. Good sized, clean rooms and working free wifi in the reception/ restaurant area.
reviews.title: Great hotel and very helpful staff

reviews.text: We stayed here for one night in mid-June and had a very nice stay. We got over our jet lag lying on the sunbeds and drinking nescafe frappes from the local taverna that is right there. The beach consists of large round stones, which makes entering and exiting the water difficult, but the water was gorgeous.
reviews.title: A lovely swimming beach and nice hotel

reviews.text: The hotel bar is comfortable and has a nice view of the beach. The breakfast buffet was decent. The rooms were large and comfortable with nice balconies overlooking the water, though I wish the bathrooms were a bit more spacious.
reviews.title: Wonderful Beach, Views but under renovation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My son and I traveled to Samos are part of a college graduation gift.
reviews.title: This hotel is probably nice in summer, but really was not ready to be open when we stayed, not a great experience.

aka: Samos Bay Hotel By Gagou Beach Greece
description: For the nature adorers with forest green and crystal blue sea, in a beautiful gulf with the beach right under your feet, you will find GAGOU BEACH HOTEL in the Greek island of Samos! Providing you with the authentic Greek hospitality, relax and enjoy your stay with a refreshment-snack on the beach or on your comfortable room balcony. You also have the choice to enjoy delicious meals, from our Greek cuisine at our hotel-restaurant "GLAFKOS" right over the Aegean Sea. It’s just a unique and ideal place for unforgettable holidays.
